content.description: In anaphase <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of meiosis, cohesion between the centromeres of sister chromatids is maintained while homologous chromosomes migrate to opposite poles of the cell along the meiotic spindle as represented in Figure 1.
content.question: Figure 1. Migration of homologous chromosomes during anaphase <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of meiosis A compound that prevents the separation of the homologous chromosomes in anaphase <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is being studied. Which of the following questions can be best answered during this study?

choices.label: Will the cells produced at the end of meiosis still be genetically identical to each other in the presence of this compound?
Will the long-term development of the individual be affected by this meiotic error?
